DynamicRequirements.instructionscraft: Below are condition lists. If conditions are met on any of the lists then the player can craft this item.
DynamicRequirements.instructionsevent: Below are condition lists. If conditions are met on any of the lists then the event can spawn/run.
DynamicRequirements.instructionsitem: Below are condition lists. If conditions are met on any of the lists then the player can use the item.
DynamicRequirements.instructionsnpcfriend: Below are condition lists. If conditions are met on any of the lists then the npc will be friendly/protect the player and cannot be hurt by the player.
DynamicRequirements.instructionsnpcattackonsight: Below are condition lists. If conditions are met on any of the lists player will be attacked on sight.
DynamicRequirements.instructionsnpcdontattackonsight: Below are condition lists. If conditions are met on any of the lists then the player will not be attacked on sight by this npc.
DynamicRequirements.instructionsnpccanbeattacked: Below are condition lists. If there are conditions, and they are not met, then the player will not be able to attack this npc.
DynamicRequirements.instructionsquest: Below are condition lists. If conditions are met on any of the lists then the player can start the quest.
DynamicRequirements.instructionsresource: Below are condition lists. If conditions are met on any of the lists then the player can harvest the resource.
DynamicRequirements.instructionsspell: Below are condition lists. If conditions are met on any of the lists then the player can use cast the spell.
DynamicRequirements.title: Dynamic Requirements

Errors.disconnectedclosing: You have lost connection to the server. The editor will now close.

Errors.resourcesnotfound: The resources directory could not be found! Intersect will now close.
Errors.UnableToParseInvalidIntegerFormat: Unable to parse '{00}', the input should only be digits and the minus sign (-) for negative numbers.

Getting Started?

        2. Open the Intersect Client and Create an Account
        3. Login to that account here to start designing your game!

MapGrid.keepmapcache: Use your current settings with the map cache? (No to disable lighting/fogs/other effects)

descriptions.ahuedesc: How strong the overlay appears. (Range: 0 [transparent/invisible] to 255 [solid/can't see map])
descriptions.bhuedesc: The amount of blue in the overlay. (Range: 0 to 255)
descriptions.brightnessdesc: How bright is this map? (Range: 0 to 100).
descriptions.fogalphadesc: How strong the fog overlay appears. (Range: 0 [transparent/invisible] to 255 [solid/can't see map])
descriptions.fogdesc: The overlayed image on the map. Generally used for fogs or sun beam effects.
descriptions.ghuedesc: The amount of green in the overlay. (Range: 0 to 255)
descriptions.musicdesc: Looping background music for this map.
descriptions.overlaygraphicdesc: This is an image that appears above the map. (Not shown in editor.)
descriptions.panoramadesc: This is an image that appears behind the map. It can be seen where no tiles are placed.
descriptions.playerlightcolordesc: Which color is the players light? (Default: White)
descriptions.playerlightexpanddesc: How far into the light does the effect start fading? (0.00 to 1.00)
descriptions.playerlightintensitydesc: How strong the light is at its brightest point. (0 to 255)
descriptions.playerlightsizedesc: How large is the light around the player? (In pixels 0-1000)
descriptions.rhuedesc: The amount of red in the overlay. (Range: 0 to 255)
descriptions.sounddesc: Looping sound effect for this map.
descriptions.zonedesc: The type of map this is.
descriptions.weatherdesc: The animation for each weather particle.
descriptions.weatherxspeeddesc: How fast horizontally weather particles move across the screen. (Range -5 to 5)
descriptions.weatheryspeeddesc: How fast vertically weather particles move across the screen. (Range -5 to 5)
descriptions.weatherintensitydesc: How intence the weather is (number of particles). (Range 0 to 100)
descriptions.hideequipmentdesc: Toggling this on will stop rendering of item paperdolls while on this map.

TimeEditor.colorpaneldesc: Double click the panel above to change the overlay color.
TimeEditor.ratedesc:
Enter 1 for normal rate of time.
Values larger than one for faster days.
Values between 0 and 1 for longer days.
Negative values for time to flow backwards.
TimeEditor.title: Time Editor (Day/Night Settings)

UpdatePacking.TargetDirectoryPromptDescription: Pick the directory in which to save the packaged update
